12.bwt:
- Coronavirus
- Bat ba dulagh di ma kwɛl ɔ nyol
- Biyemblan
- Ditombis dya dulagh dya coronavirus
- Waŋgo ɔ fiti di kombɛn nyol ɛyawɛ
- Njɛmɛ ɔ fiti di bol, na ɔ wɛl dulagh dinu
12.eng:
- Coronavirus 
- Vulnerable people
- Symptoms
- Transmission of coronavirus
- How to protect yourself
- What to do in case of contamination?
- Definition of some difficult words

17.bwt:
Coronavirus wa ba baghɛ na si COVID-19, dulagh di kɔlɔn. Ba na kolɛ di byana di botɛ ɔ mu ma lal na yogh, ɔ ngɔnd ya mandindɛn, ɔ mwa bikoli biba na dyɔm na dibugh (2019)
Dulagh mɛn di wɛl ɛyɛmblan ya ɛkosi na ɛbomb tɛ di fiti di yɛlan mot ɔ mujumb mwa mudimb. Dulagh mɛn di ma kawɛn ɔ miki jita mya mika mwase. Bibotedi bya dulagh din wan di  si bilɛni.
17.eng: Coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, is a new virus. It was first reported in China on 31 December 2019. It has flu-like symptoms and can cause death in some severe cases. It is widespread in many countries around the world. The origin of the disease is not yet known.

22.bwt: Mot wa a wɛl dulagh dya mulɛm
22.eng: Person with a heart condition or disease

23.bwt:
Bat ba dulagh di ma kwɛl ɔ nyol

Nyɔŋgɔn ɛsus ba fiti di wɛl dulagh di kɔlɔn din.
Bat ba ma jind, na  bat ba ba ma wɛl mulagh na si dulagh dyo ɔ sɔ so pɛmi lɛ, na dulagh dya fikpa na dulagh dya mulɛm, na dulagh dya maki ma kundil ɔ molo mwa mot mɔ ma befi jita na ma tani dulkagh dibey din dya ba fiŋgil na coronavirus.
23.eng:
Vulnerable people
People of all ages can become infected with this new virus. The elderly and people with pre-existing conditions (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure) seem more likely to become seriously ill from this virus.

28.eng:
Dry cough
Muscle aches and pains

29.bwt:
Biyemblan
Biyɛmblan bya dulagh dya coronavirus bi yɔ mulɛmlɛm na si ɛbomb, mubonji, ɛkosi ya ɛ fɛghɛsi, na missis mya mya wa na di jɛ.
Doŋgo dya bat ba wɛl mulagh ba wɛl buwa, na ɛbomb ya etigh mot ɔ dyo, na ɛbom ya ese fɛghɛs. Na buwa bwa etogha ngom. Na dinya dibi dya maki. Ditu dya bat ko kana ba ma wɛl dulagh mɛn, ba si wɛl eyɛmblan nde ba yɔ lɛ. Ditu bá pu esiba na ba bolan mel.
29.eng:
Symptoms
The symptoms of a coronavirus infection are similar to those of the flu: fever, dry cough, muscle aches, fatigue. Some patients have pain, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, or diarrhea. Some people, although infected, have no symptoms and feel fine. Most people recover without needing any special treatment.

32.bwt:
Ditombis dya dulagh dya coronavirus
COVID-19: dulagh din wan dyá tombɛlɛn na bat ɔ nyol a na bat ba ba wɛli dulagh mɛn, ba vutɛn bapɛ ba ba si wɛli.
Na mot a vul ɛkosi ko a simi ma byom bya bya nyet mɔ ɔ dyo na mujum byo bi yɔ dulagh mɛn.
Na mot a nɔŋg ɛfu ya mot am koso ekosi, ko di simi dulagh dinu difit di wali mot mɛn. Na mot a myeti yom ya dualgh di ma bandam wɔ, tɛ a myɛti mǐs ɛmawɛ, dyo ɛdyawɛ ko mujum ɛmwawɛ, dulagh dinu di fiti di wali mɔ.
32.eng:
Transmission of coronavirus
COVID-19 is transmitted by people carrying the virus. When a sick person coughs or sneezes, they expel droplets through their nose or mouth. If a person breathes in these droplets, they can become infected with the coronavirus. If a person touches an object infected with these droplets and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth, they can also become infected.

37.bwt: Waŋgo ɔ fiti di kombɛn nyol ɛyawɛ

38.bwt: 1.  Bol na ɔ si myɛti mǐs,dyo na mujumb ɛmawɛ.

40.bwt: 2. Yofo maka bité na bité, na sɔpi na mali ma ma yagha, tɛ ɔ tiso na tahili ya esaŋgi.
40.eng: 2. Wash your hands frequently with soap and running water. Then dry them with a clean towel.

42.bwt: 3. Ɔ koso na di simi ɔ ɛpapagh ɛyawɛ.
42.eng: 3. Cough and sneeze into the crook of your arm.

44.bwt: 4. Bol na osi dya nyam ɛpéyn na di myeti biyɛmbɛ bya bi yɔ loŋgɛ.
44.eng: 4. Avoid eating raw meat and touching live animals.

49.bwt: 5. Ɔ si vutɛn mot wa a koso na wa a simi, ɔ mima mita mwɔgh.
49.eng: 5. Keep at least one meter away from a person who is cou- ghing or sneezing.

51.bwt: 6. Ɔ si somɛn bat na maka, ɔ byawan bat na di nughi dya molo kona mujumb.
51.eng: 6. Avoid shaking hands. Greet each other with a nod or a verbal greeting.

55.bwt: 8. Si mima fumfogh si si kɛndɛ kɛndɛ.

57.bwt: 9. Si kɛg si baghɛ na di waso myaŋgo mya mya fu ditɛŋgɛn coronavirus.
57.eng: 9. Keep informed and verify the source of information.

58.bwt:
Njɛmɛ ɔ fiti di bol, na ɔ wɛl dulagh dinu

Na ɔ yɛmbi na ɔ mɔ wɛl dulagh mɛn:
-         Ɔ si yɛlagh ɔ fatɛn ya bat
-         Mima ɔ nadw ɛyawɛ
-         Ɔ fiŋgil 1510 tɛ ɔ nan malɛf ma dokta.
Ɔ fiŋgil misɔŋgi min wan:
58.eng:
What to do in case of contamination?
If you have symptoms:
- Avoid contact with other people.
- Stay at home.
- Call 1510 and follow the doctor's instructions. Other possible numbers:

64.bwt:
Kɛntɛ jɛ bwla bwa di puli dulagh dya covid-19 bu sey. Nde bat ba bugha di wasio manjɛ ma di sagh mel ɔ di puli bat.
Mot musus a wɛl di nɔŋg jangamɛn ɔ di tati nyol ɛyawɛ na dulagh di bey din na bat b aba vuten mɔ ni di si wali bɔ.
64.eng:
To date, there is no cure for COVID-19, but authorities are continuing research to find a suitable treatment.
Everyone must be responsible and take the right steps to protect themselves and those around them.

65.eng:
Definition of some difficult words

Asthma: chronic lung disorder
Contamination: infection
Diabetes: disease that occurs when the body can't use glucose normally
Flu: cough, influenza
Infected: affected, touched
Infection: disease
Instructions: direction, information
Patient: person under health care
Pre-existing conditions: long-term disease
Runny nose: excess nasal drainage
Symptoms: signs of illness
Treatment: cure, medication
Virus: disease agent
Vulnerable: defenseless, exposed

67.eng:
Njɛmɛ mot a wɛl di baghɛ ditɛŋgɛn dulagh dya CORONAVIRUS na COVID-19

Njɛmɛ mot a wɛl di baghɛ ditɛŋgɛn dulagh dya CORONAVIRUS na COVID-19


Cameroon Association for Bible Translation and Literacy

Njɛmɛ mot a wɛl di baghɛ ditɛŋgɛn dulagh dya CORONAVIRUS na COVID-19







 

             NJƐMƐ MOT A WƐL
- Coronavirus
- Bat ba dulagh di ma kwɛl ɔ nyol
- Biyemblan
- Ditombis dya dulagh dya coronavirus
- Waŋgo ɔ fiti di kombɛn nyol ɛyawɛ
- Njɛmɛ ɔ fiti di bol, na ɔ wɛl dulagh dinu



p.2
p.3
p.4
p.5
p.6

p.8

Coronavirus wa ba baghɛ na si COVID-19, dulagh di kɔlɔn. Ba na kolɛ di byana di botɛ ɔ mu ma lal na yogh, ɔ ngɔnd ya mandindɛn, ɔ mwa bikoli biba na dyɔm na dibugh (2019)
Dulagh mɛn di wɛl ɛyɛmblan ya ɛkosi na ɛbomb tɛ di fiti di yɛlan mot ɔ mujumb mwa mudimb. Dulagh mɛn di ma kawɛn ɔ miki jita mya mika mwase. Bibotedi bya dulagh din wan di  si bilɛni.


Mot a ma jind

Mot wa a wɛl dulagh dya mulɛm
Bat ba dulagh di ma kwɛl ɔ nyol

Nyɔŋgɔn ɛsus ba fiti di wɛl dulagh di kɔlɔn din.
Bat ba ma jind, na  bat ba ba ma wɛl mulagh na si dulagh dyo ɔ sɔ so pɛmi lɛ, na dulagh dya fikpa na dulagh dya mulɛm, na dulagh dya maki ma kundil ɔ molo mwa mot mɔ ma befi jita na ma tani dulkagh dibey din dya ba fiŋgil na coronavirus.


-Mubonji
-Di jɛ dya nyol

-Ekosi ya ɛfɛghɛsi-Missis mya mya wa
Biyemblan
Biyɛmblan bya dulagh dya coronavirus bi yɔ mulɛmlɛm na si ɛbomb, mubonji, ɛkosi ya ɛ fɛghɛsi, na missis mya mya wa na di jɛ.
Doŋgo dya bat ba wɛl mulagh ba wɛl buwa, na ɛbomb ya etigh mot ɔ dyo, na ɛbom ya ese fɛghɛs. Na buwa bwa etogha ngom. Na dinya dibi dya maki. Ditu dya bat ko kana ba ma wɛl dulagh mɛn, ba si wɛl eyɛmblan nde ba yɔ lɛ. Ditu bá pu esiba na ba bolan mel.

Mot na ekosi
Ditombis dya dulagh dya coronavirus
COVID-19: dulagh din wan dyá tombɛlɛn na bat ɔ nyol a na bat ba ba wɛli dulagh mɛn, ba vutɛn bapɛ ba ba si wɛli.
Na mot a vul ɛkosi ko a simi ma byom bya bya nyet mɔ ɔ dyo na mujum byo bi yɔ dulagh mɛn.
Na mot a nɔŋg ɛfu ya mot am koso ekosi, ko di simi dulagh dinu difit di wali mot mɛn. Na mot a myeti yom ya dualgh di ma bandam wɔ, tɛ a myɛti mǐs ɛmawɛ, dyo ɛdyawɛ ko mujum ɛmwawɛ, dulagh dinu di fiti di wali mɔ.




Waŋgo ɔ fiti di kombɛn nyol ɛyawɛ
1.  Bol na ɔ si myɛti mǐs,dyo na mujumb ɛmawɛ.


2. Yofo maka bité na bité, na sɔpi na mali ma ma yagha, tɛ ɔ tiso na tahili ya esaŋgi.

3. Ɔ koso na di simi ɔ ɛpapagh ɛyawɛ.

4. Bol na osi dya nyam ɛpéyn na di myeti biyɛmbɛ bya bi yɔ loŋgɛ.




5. Ɔ si vutɛn mot wa a koso na wa a simi, ɔ mima mita mwɔgh.


6. Ɔ si somɛn bat na maka, ɔ byawan bat na di nughi dya molo kona mujumb.


7. Si si yɛlagh ɔ matan.

8. Si mima fumfogh si si kɛndɛ kɛndɛ.

9. Si kɛg si baghɛ na di waso myaŋgo mya mya fu ditɛŋgɛn coronavirus.
Njɛmɛ ɔ fiti di bol, na ɔ wɛl dulagh dinu

Na ɔ yɛmbi na ɔ mɔ wɛl dulagh mɛn:
-         Ɔ si yɛlagh ɔ fatɛn ya bat
-         Mima ɔ nadw ɛyawɛ
-         Ɔ fiŋgil 1510 tɛ ɔ nan malɛf ma dokta.
Ɔ fiŋgil misɔŋgi min wan:

699 279 622
675 308 373
698 423 929
655 728 884
670 713 979

699 933 725
677 429 357
699 986 740
676 466 797
670 113 761

Kɛntɛ jɛ bwla bwa di puli dulagh dya covid-19 bu sey. Nde bat ba bugha di wasio manjɛ ma di sagh mel ɔ di puli bat.
Mot musus a wɛl di nɔŋg jangamɛn ɔ di tati nyol ɛyawɛ na dulagh di bey din na bat b aba vuten mɔ ni di si wali bɔ.

What you need to know about the

                    SUMMARY
- Coronavirus 
- Vulnerable people
- Symptoms
- Transmission of coronavirus
- How to protect yourself
- What to do in case of contamination?
- Definition of some difficult words




p.2
p.3
p.4
p.5
p.6
p.7


p.8
Coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, is a new virus. It was first reported in China on 31 December 2019. It has flu-like symptoms and can cause death in some severe cases. It is widespread in many countries around the world. The origin of the disease is not yet known.


Elderly person

Person with a heart condition or disease
Vulnerable people
People of all ages can become infected with this new virus. The elderly and people with pre-existing conditions (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure) seem more likely to become seriously ill from this virus.


Fever
Fatigue

Dry cough
Muscle aches and pains
Symptoms
The symptoms of a coronavirus infection are similar to those of the flu: fever, dry cough, muscle aches, fatigue. Some patients have pain, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, or diarrhea. Some people, although infected, have no symptoms and feel fine. Most people recover without needing any special treatment.

Person with a cough
Transmission of coronavirus
COVID-19 is transmitted by people carrying the virus. When a sick person coughs or sneezes, they expel droplets through their nose or mouth. If a person breathes in these droplets, they can become infected with the coronavirus. If a person touches an object infected with these droplets and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth, they can also become infected.




How to protect yourself
1. Avoid touching eyes, nose, mouth.

2. Wash your hands frequently with soap and running water. Then dry them with a clean towel.

3. Cough and sneeze into the crook of your arm.


4. Avoid eating raw meat and touching live animals.




5. Keep at least one meter away from a person who is cou- ghing or sneezing.


6. Avoid shaking hands. Greet each other with a nod or a verbal greeting.

7. Avoid gatherings.


8. Restrict movement.

9. Keep informed and verify the source of information.
What to do in case of contamination?
If you have symptoms:
- Avoid contact with other people.
- Stay at home.
- Call 1510 and follow the doctor's instructions. Other possible numbers:

699 279 622
675 308 373
698 423 929
655 728 884
670 713 979

699 933 725
677 429 357
699 986 740
676 466 797
670 113 761

To date, there is no cure for COVID-19, but authorities are continuing research to find a suitable treatment.
Everyone must be responsible and take the right steps to protect themselves and those around them.
Definition of some difficult words

Asthma: chronic lung disorder
Contamination: infection
Diabetes: disease that occurs when the body can't use glucose normally
Flu: cough, influenza
Infected: affected, touched
Infection: disease
Instructions: direction, information
Patient: person under health care
Pre-existing conditions: long-term disease
Runny nose: excess nasal drainage
Symptoms: signs of illness
Treatment: cure, medication
Virus: disease agent
Vulnerable: defenseless, exposed
